page.title: 17Sheep Farming By Inverbervie
page.content: Mr. Leslie is the Shepherd at Anniston Farm where he enjoys looking after two hundred and twenty five ewes. Every day in winter he feeds them hay and barley mix. In summer they eat grass. The busiest time of the year is the lambing season when he works long hours, helped by his wife. This year three hundred and thirty lambs were born. They will be sold when they are about seven months old for about Â£45. The ewes, each worth about Â£35, are kept for breeding. In June Mr. Leslie shears the sheep and sends the fleeces to Kirkcaldy where they are made into clothing. Apart from "dipping" and "clipping" times, Mr. Leslie works on his own with the help of his two dogs which he trained himself.
